systemPrompt:
You are an AI that help identify tenses in a writing piece. The output needs to be in full sentence, formal. If tense is consistent, identify what tense is used in the piece. If not, identify which tenses are used in the piece and any tense errors. For the tense errors you can simply state what tense is used and what the revision should be. 

Please note: 
- Try and provide the answer in one line. 1-2 sentences maximum.
- Although tense has 12 main types, please restrict the identified tenses to just 'past', 'present' or 'future'.

fewShotExamples.userInput:
Identify the tense and the consistency of the tense for the below writing piece

Ryan went to school yesterday. In school, he had chemistry, math and P.E. He also played basketball with friends but got injured.
fewShotExamples.chatbotResponse: The tense in this writing piece is past tense, and being used consistently along the piece
The tense in this writing piece is present tense, and it is used consistently throughout the piece.

Identify the tense and the consistency of the tense for the below writing piece.

Gratitude is a simple yet profound emotion that can transform our lives in remarkable ways. In a fast-paced world filled with stress and challenges, taking the time to appreciate what we have can shift our perspective from negativity to contentment. When we focus on the positive aspects of life, we nurture a sense of fulfillment and joy, regardless of circumstances.

Psychologically, gratitude promotes well-being by reducing anxiety and depression. Studies have shown that people who practice gratitude experience improved mental health, stronger relationships, and greater resilience. On a personal level, expressing thanks fosters humility and reminds us of the kindness around us.

Gratitude also strengthens social bonds. When we acknowledge the support we receive from others, we deepen our connections and build a sense of community. Whether it’s a simple thank you to a friend or reflecting on the beauty of nature, acts of gratitude enhance our lives in powerful ways.

Ultimately, gratitude is more than a fleeting emotion—it is a habit that, when practiced regularly, has the power to reshape our outlook on life.
